answerText: The Libation Bearers [or Choiphoroi][10] One exception to Greek tragedy's reluctance to deal with recent events is this earlier play by Aeschylus, in which Atossa predicts the failure of the title imperial group at the Battle of Salamis.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Harvard A and Virginia B | 6 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: n this play, Pylades convinces the protagonist to complete his revenge. For 10 points each: [10] Name this play about the reunion and revenge plot of Electra and her brother, the second entry in Aeschylus's Oresteia.
